clinical_study.brief_title: Psychometric Validation of the Competitive Attention Test
clinical_study.official_title: Psychometric Validation of the Competitive Attention Test (CAT) : Simultaneous and Separated Measures of Voluntary and Involuntary Attention

primary_outcome.measure: Reaction times in healthy subjects and patients with ADHD.
primary_outcome.description: Reaction times in milliseconds obtained with the CAT test in healthy participants and in patients with ADHD.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of correct responses in healthy subjects and patients with ADHD.
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of correct responses obtained with the CAT test in healthy participants and in patients with ADHD.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Healthy participants aged from 6 to 90 year-old
patients with ADHD with no treatment
arm_group.description: patients with ADHD aged from 6 to 90 year-old with no treatment
patients with ADHD aged from 6 to 90 year-old with psychostimulant treatment (Methylphenidate)

intervention.intervention_name: experience 1 : Competitive attention test in healthy participants
intervention.description: Comparison of behavioral measures (reaction times and percentage of correct responses) obtained twice with the CAT test in healthy participants (2 to 6 weeks apart).
intervention.arm_group_label: Healthy participants aged from 6 to 90 year-old

intervention.intervention_name: experience 2 : Competitive attention test in patients with ADHD with no treatment
intervention.description: Behavioral (reaction times and percentage of correct responses) and Electroencephalography (EEG) measures obtained with the CAT test in patients with ADHD with no treatment.
intervention.arm_group_label: patients with ADHD with no treatment

intervention.intervention_name: experience 3 :Competitive attention test in patients with ADHD with psychostimulant treatment
intervention.description: Behavioral (reaction times and percentage of correct responses) and EEG measures obtained with the CAT test in patients with ADHD before and after psychostimulant treatment.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
healthy major participants:
- Age from 18 to 90 year-old
- Informed consent to participate in the study
- No neurological or psychiatric disorder
- No history of neuro-psychiatric disorder or neurodevelopmental type dysphasia, dyslexia, dyspraxia, attention deficit disorder
healthy minor participants:
- Age from 6 to 17 year-old
- Informed consent of parents or guardians for the child's participation in the study
- No neurological or psychiatric disorder
- No history of neuro-psychiatric disorder or neurodevelopmental type dysphasia, dyslexia, dyspraxia, Attention deficit disorder
ADHD minor patients:
- Age from 6 to 17 year-old
- Informed consent of parents or guardians for the child's participation in the study
- ADHD Diagnosis with or without hyperactivity
- No psychiatric history other than ADHD.
- For Experience 3: treatment in progress.
Exclusion Criteria:
healthy major participants
- Age below 18 or above 90 year-old
- unaffiliated or non-beneficiaries of the social security scheme
healthy minor participants:
- Age below 6 or above 18 year-old
- unaffiliated or non-beneficiaries of the social security scheme
ADHD minor patients:
- Age below 6 or above 18 year-old
- unaffiliated or non-beneficiaries of the social security scheme
